channel.title: Reports & Analytics on SmartWeb Support
channel.description: Recent content in Reports & Analytics on SmartWeb Support

item.title: About Creating Work Reports
item.description:
Work Reports Overview link

Work reports are important analytical tools in SmartWeb’s support management. You can visualize detailed business performance for assigned agents, departments, teams, specific tags, support channels, and more. The CSV export functionality makes it easy to perform data analysis and integrate with external tools. This contributes to improving team productivity and optimizing customer support strategies.

How to Create Work Reports link

Accessing the Reports Screen link

Access the “Reports” section from the left menu of the agent screen. By selecting the desired report type, detailed business analysis is possible. Main analysis targets include:

item.title: About Report Items (Information Types)
item.description:
About Report Items (Information Types) link

This document explains the details of various types of information that can be extracted in reports. (Updated 2017/12/26)

Answers link

  • Number of replies to tickets created from email, forums, etc. (chat support not included)
  • Email responses from chat-created tickets are counted

Answer Time Related link

New Answer Average Time <New answer avg time(hours)> link

  • Average time required to respond to “new” tickets
  • Measures time from ticket creation to switching to “answered” status

Open Answer Average Time <Open answer avg time(hours)> link

  • Average time required to respond to “open” tickets
  • Measures time from ticket receipt to switching to “answered” status

Chat Related link

Total Chats link

  • Chats initiated when users click the chat button
  • Includes invitation chats and manually started chats from the online visitor screen

Chat Messages link

  • Number of messages sent by agents
  • Welcome messages are also counted as “1”

Chat Types and Status link

  • Missed Chats
  • Chat Pickup
  • Incoming Chats
  • Finished Chats
  • Unanswered Chats

Chat Time Related link

  • Chat Pickup Average Time <Chat pickup avg time(minutes)>
  • Chat Average Time <Chat avg time(minutes)>

Call Related link

Total Calls and Types link

  • Calls
  • Outgoing Calls
  • Missed Calls
  • Incoming Calls
  • Finished Calls

Call Time Related link

  • Call Minutes
  • Outgoing Call Minutes
  • Call Pick Up Average Time
  • Call Average Time
  • Outgoing Call Average Time

Rating Related link

  • Not Ranked
  • Not Ranked (%)
  • Good Rating
  • Good Rating (%)

item.title: About Tag Reports
item.description:
What are Tag Reports link

Tag reports are compiled based on “tags” added to tickets. Detailed analysis is possible by date, period, agent, team, and channel.

Important Notes When Using Reports link

  • Data measurement begins from the point when tags are used.
  • If tags are added after email replies or chat completion, some items may not be reflected in the report.
  • Unlike other LiveAgent reports, some items require advance configuration.

Report Configuration Tips link

To include tags added to tickets after completion in the aggregation, please add “Created Tickets” from the information type to the items.

item.title: Agent Activity Reports
item.description:
Overview of LiveAgent Reporting Features link

LiveAgent provides graphical reports on customer service statistics. From activity performance of individual agents and teams to channel usage comparisons and tag aggregations, it offers all the necessary content for analyzing customer support.

How to Access Reports link

To view reports, select “Reports” from the left menu in the agent interface. Each report also supports CSV format export.

Detailed Report Items link

Analysis Summary link

Displays aggregated data from various reports in graph format. This is the ideal report for understanding the performance overview of the help desk department. To view details of each report, click “View Details” in the upper right of each report item.

item.title: Analytics Overview
item.description:
Overview of Analytics Overview link

Analytics Overview is a dashboard feature that provides an at-a-glance view of overall system performance. It aggregates key metrics such as ticket count, response time, and SLA achievement rate, making it useful for everyone from executives to frontline leaders.

Main Features link

For example, administrators can check the dashboard to understand which time periods have concentrated inquiries and optimally allocate personnel. It’s also possible to discover business processes that need improvement by analyzing long-term trends.

item.title: Benchmarks & Leaderboards
item.description:
Overview of Benchmarks and Leaderboards link

Purpose of the Feature link

A feature that compares agent performance metrics (response counts, call counts, online time, etc.) with other agents in real-time and displays them as rankings. It aims to balance performance visualization with motivation enhancement.

Motivation Enhancement Mechanism link

For example, by visualizing daily response activities, it can promote positive behaviors such as “wanting to catch up” rather than just “preventing laziness.” Rankings can be switched by different periods such as “today,” “last week,” “this month,” which helps with goal setting and reflection. Furthermore, when linked with recognition systems and incentive programs, it can also enhance team competitiveness and unity.

item.title: Channel Report
item.description:
What is Channel Report link

The Channel Report is a feature that analyzes inquiry status across multiple channels such as email, chat, phone, and social media. It helps identify which channels are most utilized and assists in formulating support strategies.

Customer Segment Trends in Channel Selection link

For example, younger customers tend to prefer chat and social media, while business customers tend to choose email and phone. By referencing channel-specific data, you can prepare appropriate response methods for each segment.

item.title: Customer Service Reporting Features
item.description:
Overview of Customer Service Reporting Features link

What is Customer Service Reporting? link

Customer Service Reporting is an analytics feature that provides an overview of all customer service requests and related activities. It offers insights to understand your customer support team’s performance, areas for improvement, and outstanding departments.

Key Report Analysis Items link

  • Complete analytics overview
  • Performance reports
  • Agent rankings
  • Tag reports
  • SLA compliance reports
  • SLA log reports
  • Agent activity status
  • Channel reports
  • Department reports
  • Time reports

Importance of Customer Service Reporting link

The Need for Report Review link

Regularly reviewing reports is essential when using online customer service software. This ensures you meet customer needs and expectations while improving business practices, products, and the services you provide.

item.title: Department Report
item.description:
Overview of Department Report link

Department Report is a feature that analyzes inquiry status and performance for each department. It enables measurement of efficiency and results at the department level, leading to optimization of the entire organization.

Purpose and Significance of Analysis link

For example, by understanding which department receives more inquiries between the technical support department and sales department, you can adjust necessary resources accordingly. Additionally, by comparing SLA achievement rates and customer satisfaction levels across departments, you can formulate improvement strategies.

item.title: Live Chat Reports
item.description:
Live Chat Report Overview link

Displays LiveAgent live chat support reports for the last 30 days. Compare the number of people waiting in live chat queues with the number of responding agents to verify if appropriate support systems are maintained. Each report item can also be exported in CSV format.

How to Access Reports link

To view this report, select “Reports” > “Chat” from the left menu in the agent interface.

item.title: My Work Report
item.description:
Work Report Overview link

Report Display Feature link

Logged-in agents can view their own customer service reports anytime through graphs and tables.

Report Customization link

In addition to time periods, you can add channels, teams, and tags to search conditions to create detailed reports.

Report Analysis Features link

Performance Visualization link

This report allows you to compare the number of cases handled per hour and customer evaluations at a glance.

item.title: Performance Report
item.description:
Performance Report Overview link

Performance Report is a feature that comprehensively evaluates system-wide and agent activities. You can measure response speed, resolution rate, processing volume, and more.

Main Functions and Purpose link

Performance Metrics Measurement link

By quantifying achievements in daily operations, you can discover improvement opportunities and success stories. For example, you can reference teams with particularly excellent response speeds to help improve other teams.

Data-Driven Decision Making link

Data-driven decisions can elevate overall performance across the board.

item.title: Phone Reports
item.description:
Overview link

This displays reports on Twilio phone and voice conversation handling for the past 30 days. You can compare the number of people waiting on the phone with the number of responding agents to verify whether you’re maintaining an appropriate support structure. Each report item can also be exported in CSV format.

How to Access Reports link

To view this report, select “Reports” > “Calls” from the left menu in the agent screen.

item.title: Smart Ticket Reports
item.description:
Smart Ticket Reports Overview link

Displays reports on tickets issued from LiveAgent for the past 30 days. Can be used to verify whether ticket processing was completed within appropriate timeframes (SLA), whether the number of responding agents is adequate, and more. Each report item can also be exported in CSV format.

To view this report, select “Reports” > “Tickets” from the left menu in the agent screen.

Report Details link

Ticket Load link

Used to analyze whether there are sufficient agents handling ticket processing, or whether there are issues with each person’s response skills. This item compares the number of available agents, ticket issuance count, and live chat queue count by minimum, maximum, and average values respectively.

item.title: Tag Reports
item.description:
What are Tag Reports link

Tag reports are a feature that aggregates and analyzes tags assigned to tickets. It enables classification and understanding of inquiry content and trends.

Use Cases for Tag Analysis link

For example, by aggregating counts based on tags like “billing,” “technical,” and “returns,” you can identify which areas have concentrated problems. This allows you to clarify areas that need improvement and the necessity for new FAQs.

item.title: Time Report
item.description:
What is Time Report link

Time Report is a feature that records detailed time spent on ticket handling.

Purpose link

It analyzes processing time for each agent and department, helping improve productivity and efficiency.

Analysis and Utilization Methods link

Processing Time Analysis link

For example, by identifying cases with long average processing times and analyzing the causes, improvement measures can be implemented. When specific tasks require significant time, it serves as guidance for reviewing workflows or conducting additional training.
